p.s: In her blog post on Environmentenvironment, published on the fifth of February 2014, the Autorauthor Ankita Mitra writes about pollution and the hazardous effects it has on our world.
She talks about planet earth, and about the incredible circumstances in which life developed on it.
She tries to bring the concept of the earth and the life on it being special, closer to the readers.
Making the readers appriciateappreciate their existance even more.
Shortly after, she destroys the idea of living on peacefully, by explaining the consequences of pollution.
She talks about what is effected by it and how devestatingdevastating these effects are.
There are a few ennumerationenumerations thrououtthroughout the text, all of them counting negativnegative things.
The negativnegative words also effectaffect the reader in a negativnegative way, encouraging them to truly think about how pollution is or can affect their life.
For example in lines 20-25 or line 13: ... devastating effects on sea life, on crops and on human health.
The Autorauthor gives an example of how destructive the industrial pollution really is (lines 29-32).

She voices her concerns and her opinion becomes quite clear in the last few lines 33-37, when she encoursages the readers again to think and act by mentioning the permanent damage pollution is leaving on our environment, our world and the life on it.
